comment._content: This "Confederate" uniform looks as much as many of the Union frock coats pictured prior to this one. At the outbreak of hostilities, BOTH sides wore Blue and Grey interchangeably. At First Manassas, 1861, Sherman was commanding a cavalry unit, which wore grey, a PA Zouave Regiment was wearing grey. Several companies of the 33rd Virginia Regiment (Stonewall Jackson's) were wearing Mexican War era blue frocks as pictured above.
